intro: Microstylis rhinoceros, commonly known as the rhinoceros sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of sedges. It thrives in wet or marshy habitats, often found in temperate regions. Microstylis rhinoceros plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
